entry.title: Improving Spark Performance with Broadcast Variables
entry.summary: This recipe explains how to use broadcast variables distribute immutable reference data across a Spark cluster. Using broadcast variables can improve performance by reducing the amount of network traffic and data serialization required to execute your Spark application.

entry.title: Configuring an S3 VPC Endpoint for a Spark Cluster
entry.summary: This recipe shows how to set up a VPC Endpoint for Amazon S3, which allows your Spark cluster to interact with S3 resources from a private subnet without a Network Address Translation (NAT) instance or Internet Gateway.

entry.title: Updated for Spark 1.6.1
entry.summary: All recipes have been updated and tested against Spark 1.6.1.

entry.title: Building Spark Applications with Maven
entry.summary: This recipe covers the use of Apache Maven to build and bundle Spark applications written in Java or Scala. It focuses very narrowly on a subset of commands relevant to Spark applications, including managing library dependencies, packaging, and creating an assembly JAR file.

entry.title: Using SQL and User-Defined Functions with Spark DataFrames
entry.summary: This recipe demonstrates how to query Spark DataFrames with Structured Query Language (SQL). The Spark SQL library supports SQL as an alternate way to work with DataFrames that is compatible with the code-based approach discussed in the recipe, Working with Spark DataFrames.
